title: South Koreans to Decide Presidential Race Marked by Clashes and Contrasts
sub_head: Lee Jae-myung, a progressive, is in a close contest with Yoon Suk-yeol, a conservative, with potential shifts in the country’s relations with the U.S. and North Korea at stake
body:
SEOUL—South Korea elects a new president on Wednesday, choosing the winner of a brutish race who will determine how Seoul addresses economic discontent at home, aligns with Washington and approaches the Kim Jong Un regime.
Polls suggested a close contest between progressive Lee Jae-myung of the ruling Democratic Party and conservative Yoon Suk-yeol of the opposition People Power Party.
